other_tests.findings: Chronic hepatitis with a score of 3 for portal activity, score of 2 for lobular activity, bridging fibrosis, and no cirrhosis.
Malignant cells consistent with hepatocellular carcinoma.
Post-procedure CT revealed perihepatic hematoma and extension of the hematoma over three days.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI revealed nodular enhancement surrounding the ablation zone, suggesting residual disease.

other_tests.findings: Initial negative result; subsequent test resulted in 0.64 Bethesda units and later at 1.66 Bethesda units.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Inhibitor detected after previous undetectable results, indicating development of a factor VIII inhibitor.

other_tests.findings: Progressive improvement in coagulation parameters during surgery, without factor VIII replacement needed postoperatively.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The activated partial-thromboplastin time was normal by completion of the operation; postoperative factor VIII levels remained normal.
